sentences.english: Kevin Huang and David Lin are classmates.
sentences.chinese: 黃課文和林大衛是同班同學。

sentences.english: I made/had him copy the lesson 20 times.
sentences.chinese: 我叫他把這篇課文抄寫20遍。

sentences.english: After class, I always review lessons and sing some chants.
sentences.chinese: 死啊課後，我總會複習課文然後唱一些頌歌。

sentences.english: It is necessary and appropriate that the interest should he listed into the standard system of the text compiling.
sentences.chinese: 將趣味性列入課文編選的標準體系是必要的和適宜的。

sentences.english: Go on learning the text in groups , and translate.
sentences.chinese: 小組內自學課文，熟讀並翻譯。

sentences.english: Read the text with your parter, then act it out.
sentences.chinese: 小組合作分角色朗讀課文。

sentences.english: Students read texts loudly and clearly in class.
sentences.chinese: 課堂上同學們很認真地朗聲讀課文。

sentences.english: Write a quick outline of the text.
sentences.chinese: 寫一篇冗長的課文綱目。

sentences.english: Have students read their own text in groups, and then in class.
sentences.chinese: 在理解課文的基礎上仿寫課文。

sentences.english: Have students read their own text in groups, and then in class.
sentences.chinese: 在理解課文的基礎上仿寫課文。

sentences.english: Choose the best answer according to the text.
sentences.chinese: 根據課文內容選擇最佳選項。

sentences.english: I stuttered when reciting the text today, so he criticized me directly.
sentences.chinese: 我今天背課文時磕磕巴巴的，他直衝我刮鼻子。

sentences.english: In Chinese, often with text content impromptu performance figures.
sentences.chinese: 語文課上，常常即興配合課文內容進行人物表演。

sentences.english: Today we shingl study the text first: then I'll ask you a few pre-determined questions.
sentences.chinese: 而今大師先看課文，然後我問幾個問題。

sentences.english: Yes, the teacher says recitation is real good.
sentences.chinese: 是的，老師說背誦課文真的有好處。

sentences.english: These questions most revolve the text content to design.
sentences.chinese: 這些問題多數是圍繞課文內容而設計的。

definition: faulty wording/mispronunciation due to a speech defect
to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing/to punctuate
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
to cherish the memory of/to think of/reminisce
to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
Three Character Classic, 13th century reading primer consisting of Confucian tenets in lines of 3 characters
Three Hundred Tang Poems, an anthology collected around 1763 by Sun Zhu 孫誅
to repeat a lesson/to learn by heart/to endorse a check
